greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Number of zero digits in n.
link: Hieronymus Fischer, Table of n, a(n) for n = 0..10000
formula: a(n) = m + 1 - A055640(n) = Sum_{j=1..m+1} (1 + floor(n/10^j) - floor(n/10^j+0.9)), where m = floor(log_10(n)).
a(n) = if n<10 then A000007(n) else a(A059995(n)) + A000007(A010879(n)). - _Reinhard Zumkeller_, Apr 30 2013, corrected by _M. F. Hasler_, Jun 22 2018
example: a(99) = 0 because the digits of 99 are 9 and 9, a(100) = 2 because the digits of 100 are 1, 0 and 0 and there are two 0's.
program: | otherwise = a055641 n' + 0 ^ d where (n',d) = divMod n 10
(PARI) a(n)=if(n,n=digits(n); sum(i=2,#n,n[i]==0), 1) \\ _Charles R Greathouse IV_, Sep 13 2015
results.author: _Henry Bottomley_, Jun 06 2000
